str2: In like manner, similarly, in the same way, equally. Adverb from homoios; similarly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
From gramma. A writer, i.e. scribe or secretary.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To mock, ridicule. From en and paizo; to jeer at, i.e. Deride.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.
Other, another (of more than two), different. A primary word; 'else, ' i.e. Different.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.
